comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: " ... Built by John Elder & Co, Glasgow, she was launched on 6th June 1872 Chartered by the Orient Line for their London Australia service in 1878 and returned to the Valparaiso route in 1881. Sold to Verdeau & Cie, Bordeaux in 1895, renamed EGYPTE ... " from - www.clydesite.co.uk/clydebuilt/viewship.asp?id=471 Which may mean this photo is between 1878 and 1881. She first arrived in Sydney in July 1878 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13411764 . Though it looks like there was another visit in 1884 between Charente and Valparaiso, presumably under the PSNC flag as marked. Hmmm.

comment._content: The garden arch (see note bottom right) must belong to this house on MacMahons Point, photographed by John Degotardi in the 1870s - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=823854&am... - from the album acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemdetailpaged.aspx?itemid=420980# Which might interest [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/] & [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02/]
